trans-unit.source: Represents information related to the scope of data provided by an input method.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.InputScope%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement.InputScope%2A> properties to get an <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputScope> for a particular element.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputScope"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the input scope name.
Using an input scope name is the simplest way to refer to an <xref:System.Windows.Input.InputScope> for an element.
A member of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputScopeName"></xref> enumeration specifying a name for this input scope.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputScopeNameValue.Default"></xref>.
Raised when an attempt is made to set this property to any value other than a valid member of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.InputScopeName"></xref> enumeration.
Gets a collection of phrases to be used as suggested input patterns by input processors.
An object containing a collection of phrases to be used as suggested input patterns by input processors.
This object implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> interface.
This property has no default value.
Gets or sets a regular expression to be used as a suggested text input pattern by input processors.
A string that defines a regular expression to be used as a suggested text input pattern by input processors.
This property has no default value.
Raised when an attempt is made to set this property to **null**.
Gets or sets a string that specifies any Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) markup to be used as a suggested input pattern by input processors.
Currently, this property is only applicable to speech input.
A string that specifies any SRGS markup to be used as a suggested input pattern by input processors.
This property has no default value.
Raised when an attempt is made to set this property to **null**.
